intro: Desmofischera monosperma, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits containing a single seed. Its botanical features include a unique vascular system and the presence of calcium oxalate crystals in its tissues. Desmofischera monosperma is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is occasionally used in traditional medicine.
